education_text.0: During the 1950s, Noe served as the assistant director of Engineering at Stanford Research Institute (now      SRI International SRI International), during which time he led the technical team for the      Electronic Recording Machine, Accounting Electronic Recording Machine, Accounting (ERMA) projectIn 1968 he was recruited by the      University of Washington University of Washington to chair its newly founded Computer Science Group, a role in which he continued until 1976
